decks.notes: This deck focuses on utilizing Mystic Forge and various artifact mana ramp (such as Grim Monolith and Basalt Monolith) to generate mana and dig through the deck to find combo pieces. The goal is to assemble key artifacts like Urza's Tower and Urza's Workshop to power out high-cost artifacts like Karn, the Great Creator and Ugin, Eye of the Storms, while also using cards like The One Ring and Glaring Fleshraker to create an unbeatable board state. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with its powerful artifacts and efficient mana generation.

The main concept of this Legacy Lands deck is to utilize lands as control elements, utilizing cards like Crop Rotation, Wasteland, and Life from the Loam to disrupt the opponent's strategy and prevent them from developing their board. The deck also focuses on creating powerful land combos, such as the Dark Depths/Thespian's Stage combo, to generate threats and finish the game. Additionally, the deck includes utility lands like Karakas and Bojuka Bog to deal with problematic creatures or graveyards. The goal is to outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent through land manipulation and control.

This Grixis Aggro deck focuses on utilizing aggressive creatures like Dragon's Rage Channeler and Delver of Secrets, backed up by efficient removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Wasteland to control the board and pressure the opponent's life total. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Force of Will and Daze to protect its threats and disrupt the opponent's game plan. With cantrips like Ponder and Brainstorm to help find the right cards, this deck aims to quickly close out the game before the opponent can stabilize.

The deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with powerful creatures like Murktide Regent and Archon of Cruelty, then using Reanimate or Animate Dead to bring them back into play. It includes disruptive cards like Thoughtseize and Daze to control the opponent's actions, along with card draw and manipulation tools like Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Ponder. The deck also features a strong removal suite with cards like Brazen Borrower and Archon of Cruelty, creating a versatile and deadly combo strategy that can overwhelm the opponent in Legacy 1 vs 1 matches.

The deck focuses on aggressive strategies by utilizing creatures like Wight of the Reliquary, Scythecat Cub, and Endurance to quickly pressure the opponent. It also includes disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Dismember to control the game. Green Sun's Zenith helps tutor for key creatures like Collector Ouphe or Keen-Eyed Curator. The deck also aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like Barrowgoyf and Orcish Bowmasters. The mana base is optimized with fetchlands and utility lands like Gaea's Cradle, Bojuka Bog, and Wasteland to ensure consistent mana production and disruption.

The key concept of this deck is to control the game by utilizing lands as the main resource. By using cards like Life from the Loam, Thespian's Stage, and Crop Rotation, the deck aims to create powerful land synergies such as Dark Depths and Urza's Saga. Additionally, the deck includes disruptive elements like Wasteland and Boseiju, Who Endures to hinder the opponent's game plan. The deck also has versatile options with cards like Expedition Map and Once Upon a Time to find key pieces when needed. Overall, the strategy revolves around controlling the game with powerful land interactions and disrupting the opponent's strategy.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly access and play Necrodominance, utilizing cards like Dark Ritual, Lotus Petal, and Witherbloom Apprentice to generate fast mana. The deck also includes disruption spells like Duress and Thoughtseize to protect the combo pieces, along with removal spells like Fatal Push. Sheoldred, the Apocalypse and Dauthi Voidwalker provide additional value and protection. The deck aims to control the game with a fast and powerful combo, while also disrupting the opponent's strategy through targeted discard and removal spells.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly flood the board with aggressive creatures like Dragon's Rage Channeler and Murktide Regent, while using powerful spells like Lightning Bolt and Unholy Heat to control the opponent's board. The deck also utilizes countering spells like Force of Will and Daze to protect its own creatures, along with card draw and manipulation spells like Brainstorm and Ponder to ensure consistent draws. With a mix of aggressive creatures, control spells, and card advantage, this UR Aggro deck aims to quickly overwhelm the opponent and secure a victory.

The main concept of this Eldrazi Aggro deck is to quickly play large Eldrazi creatures such as Reality Smasher and Thought-Knot Seer, while disrupting the opponent's game plan by using cards like Chalice of the Void and Wasteland. The deck aims to apply pressure on the opponent early in the game with aggressive creatures and control the board with disruptive spells. By utilizing cards like Eye of Ugin and Eldrazi Temple, the deck can efficiently cast its powerful Eldrazi creatures and overwhelm the opponent before they have a chance to stabilize.

This deck aims to quickly get powerful creatures into the graveyard, then bring them back into play using reanimation spells like Reanimate and Animate Dead. The key strategy revolves around cheating expensive creatures like Archon of Cruelty and Atraxa, Grand Unifier into play ahead of curve, overwhelming the opponent with powerful threats while also disrupting their game plan with counterspells like Daze and Force of Will. The deck also includes card draw and selection spells like Brainstorm and Ponder to help find combo pieces and answer threats efficiently.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan with a combination of hand disruption spells like Thoughtseize and counterspells like Force of Will, while also applying pressure with efficient creatures like Brazen Borrower and Murktide Regent. It leans heavily on tempo plays, utilizing cards like Daze and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student to maintain control of the game. The deck also includes removal spells like Fatal Push to deal with opposing threats. The mana base is carefully constructed to ensure consistent access to both blue and black mana sources.

This deck focuses on quickly filling up the graveyard with powerful creatures like Archon of Cruelty and Atraxa, Grand Unifier using cards like Entomb and Thoughtseize, then bringing them back into play with Reanimate. It also includes disruption spells like Force of Will and Daze to protect the combo. The deck utilizes a combination of control elements, card filtering, and efficient mana sources to set up explosive plays and overwhelm the opponent with powerful threats from the graveyard.

The deck relies on generating efficient mana through cards like Chrome Mox, Dark Ritual, and Mox Opal to quickly assemble a lethal storm count. It utilizes discard spells like Duress and Thoughtseize to disrupt the opponent's game plan and protect its combo pieces. The combo finish involves using cards like Infernal Tutor and Ad Nauseam to search for and cast Tendrils of Agony, dealing massive damage. The Wishclaw Talisman serves as a makeshift tutor for key combo pieces, while cards like Cabal Ritual and Lion's Eye Diamond provide additional mana acceleration. The deck aims to win the game in one explosive turn.

The main focus of this deck is to utilize cards like Stock Up, Torpor Orb, and Phyrexian Dreadnought to control the pace of the game and limit the opponent's options. By using a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and card draw engines like Brainstorm and Ponder, the deck aims to maintain board control and pressure the opponent into making suboptimal plays. The inclusion of cards like Urza's Saga and Mox Diamond also allows for efficient mana ramping and the ability to quickly deploy threats.

The deck focuses on utilizing the combo potential of Nadu, Winged Wisdom to create a powerful win condition. It includes cards that enable card draw and mana ramp to quickly assemble the combo pieces. The protection is provided through counterspells like Force of Will and interaction with cards like Endurance and Teferi, Time Raveler. The deck has a mix of control elements and creatures to create a versatile strategy. The key is to efficiently tutor for and protect Nadu, while also disrupting the opponent's game plan.

The main focus of this deck is to efficiently assemble the Doomsday combo by utilizing cards such as Brainstorm, Ponder, and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student to set up the perfect pile with Thassa's Oracle as the win condition. The deck also incorporates disruption elements like Force of Will, Daze, and Thoughtseize to protect the combo and disrupt the opponent's game plan. It aims to control the board with cards like Wasteland and Stifle while utilizing fast mana sources such as Dark Ritual and Lotus Petal to quickly combo off and win the game.
